You're better off spending hard earned money at places like Sugoi or Live Sushi Bar :/
author: vivian s.

description: This is a surprisingly great pick for vegetarians: there are plenty of options and all are delicious! I recommend sitting at the bar if you are solo or on a date. The bar staff is friendly and helpful with menu choices.
author: Lauren A.

description:
I feel bad writing this review as we've come to love Tataki as a decent neighborhood sushi joint but last night's experience was just plain awful. And to add insult to injury we walked out $70 poorer and an evening full of stomach pains ahead of us.

The chef has changed within the last two months (confirmed by two staff) and with it, the quality has gone off the cliff -- nothing was fresh, my albacore nigiri -- something I typically look forward to -- was miscolored and bland -- it simply looked old. 

Also, we ordered their special Albacore belly and it arrived torched. Why would you blow torch albacore toro unless you were trying to hide the quality of the fish - complete waste.

Both my husband and I had stomach pain all night. I really hope they fix up their act and bring back the quality we are used to but otherwise, we will not be back.
author: Anna E.

description:
Don't be deceived by the good reviews. The crowd here is mostly upper middle class families/couples with young children. The noise level was tolerable for a date or general conversation. It took a few of minutes before a server acknowledged us but we were pretty much seated right away after that. She did deny our request to sit by the window, citing that it's for "3 people", even though we saw a couple sitting there on our way out. First strike. 

Food: we ordered several "happy hour" rolls, a tataki roll, and a tonkatsu ramen. The happy hour rolls were fine (5pcs if you order the cut option btw) and the tataki roll was good. The presentation was nice and it tasted very good. However, the ramen was where it all went downhill. While I know this place isn't exclusively a ramen restaurant, it was an insult to ramen. They claim to simmer the broth overnight.. but in what? Salt? It looks milky like tonkatsu ramen usually does but it did not have the rich flavor that it should. All I could taste was salt, and even the soft boiled egg was extremely salty. While I appreciate the effort in seasoning the egg unlike many ramen joints, it was a total miss. The only thing they did right was the presentation of the  chashu (seared nicely) and the fact that they used sturdy ramen noodles with just the right amount of chewiness. For $13 a bowl, this ramen isn't even worth it if you're desperate for ramen. 

Service: returning to the service portion, it was standard. They asked if we wanted a refill on water at the end but not during the meal. The waiter introduced himself and seemed pretty professional.

I would only return for the rolls, but even then there are literally dozens of restaurants just like this.
author: Diana S.

description:
I'm always up for sushi during my trips to San Francisco...  the SF raw scene rocks!  There's no comparison to sushi I can find in Phoenix... 

So, when my sushi eating Yelper in Crime, Andrea R suggested we head to Tataki to mix things up on  a recent Sunday night, I was game.  We hopped in an uber and headed over... 

Luckily, there was no wait when we arrived and we were seated immediately.  The restaurant is clean and has a great vibe... not stuffy but not too casual.  They are known for being the "first sustainable sushi restaurant in the U.S." as they sell only responsibly sourced, environmentally friendly seafood.  Everything they serve is presented beautifully as well.

They were out of several of the wines on the menu, but we ordered a glass of Sauv Blanc each and the eggplant appetizer to start.  We also shared edamame and hotate before the rolls rolled in.  Some of our faves were:

-The Candlestick (artic char, lemon, avocado, asparagus, red tobiko)
-The Extinguisher (spicy albacore, avocado, habanero masago, spicy aioli)
-The Golden State (spicy scallop, apple, seared albacore, avocado, yuzu tobiko)

But I didn't take a bad bite of anything during our visit!

Service was spot on and very knowledgeable about the dietary restrictions we had.  Looks like we've found yet another raw fish winner to return to!
author: Gabi M.

description: Great selection for happy hour! Their eggplant appetizer was delish. Sushi was too! Ambience was nice. Service was great as well.
author: Rose T.

description: This place is always filled with friendly staff and amazing food. My boyfriend and I usually order a bowl of ramen and a couple of sushi rolls. Great atmosphere and parking isn't too bad. Once your stuffed by the great food take a walk to the full house house... it's only like a block or 2 away.
author: Corina R.

description:
Sushi happy hour is always the best decision.

Price: Look to spend aabout $5-10 on each happy hour item.

Parking: street

Food:
Spicy Garlic Edamame, Extinguisher roll, spicy tuna roll, and 12 piece sashimi ($25?)
I can't complain about the food, but it wasn't amazing.
I would come here again because it was pretty hip with good service and value.
author: Krystle T.

description: If you are looking for great Japanese in San Francisco, Tataki is your best bet. With great staff and service, they provide more than just a good meal. They have a fantastic happy hour, with drink and meal choices. Tataki serves sustainable sushi, always fresh and tasty. Never leave this place disappointed.
author: Nicholas A.

description: My favorite neighborhood sushi restaurant. The sushi is always so fresh and delicious!
author: Victoria H.

description:
Ordered the tataki and spicy tuna rolls. 

Portions were a bit small. However, the quality of the food was excellent. 

Really enjoyed the casual atmosphere and the decor.
author: Konstantin G.

description: Fresh fish for decent price.
author: Kimberly H.

description: I love that Tataki took over this larger space a few years ago, so now I can give a positive rating for their service too.  Their nigiri sushi, sashimi, and rolls continue to be super fresh and delicious and environmentally-conscious. Prices are what you would expect at a quality San Francisco restaurant, but they have a good Happy Hour menu.  Cocktails are just so so.
author: JJ M.

description:
The lady and I went here as they have vegan options for their sushi and it was amazing.  It's not just *vegetables* stuffed in a roll.  These are crafted with care as they would do for the raw-fish nigiri.  The presentation is impeccable and the flavor combinations are worth the visit and your money.   

The staff was great and very friendly, we're definitely coming back.  So happy to find a great sushi spot for date night.
author: Toome B.

description:
I came here on a spontaneous sushi date with my boyfriend, and I had chosen Tataki over another sushi restaurant that I cannot recall at the moment. Part of me wishes that I had chosen the other one instead. There was plenty of seating when I first arrived, but those place settings were not cleaned up. When I was finally seated at the bar, I realized that the seats were too high and very uncomfortable. Super awkward trying to sit down.

My boyfriend and I ordered the extinguisher roll and a selection of nigiri. The rice tasted like it had been sitting there all day, and something was off about the fish. Tasted rubbery and not fresh. The staff tried their best that evening, so I would be willing to give this place another try, but needless to say, I was not impressed with the food or facilities on my first visit here.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Got the tataki roll, and it melted in my mouth. It's one of their specialty rolls. Really high quality food. High-end restaurant portions though. Don't come expecting to be really full; the portions are satisfying. 

Good for dates -- dim lights, okay prices (definitely not cheap but not TOO expensive either) 

Drinks are kind of expensive here, but I expect most sushi restaurants in SF to charge around this much for sake.

Really friendly staff. Pretty interior/lights. Calming/classy music. Chill atmosphere. I would definitely come back when I'm in there area.
author: Angela L.

description: Amazing sushi! My new favorite in all of SF! I highly recommend the extinguisher and the double double roll!
author: Debra K.

description: Came here late on a weekday night and had no problem getting seated. We started with chicken gyoza and those were amazing. Ordered three different rolls: Philadelphia, California and spicy tuna for the 2 of us. All were good, but a little on the small side. We left hungry because of the roll size.
author: Gina B.

description:
Overall I like this restaurant for the fun and trendy atmosphere, I would definitely come back for date night if I was in the area. I thought the food was just okay, so I wouldn't go out of my way to visit.

Here's the breakdown on what we ordered:

- Garlic edamame: it was tasty, a little mushy, serving was size okay
- Veggie gyoza: average, on the smaller side
- Mixed veggie rolls, vegan California roll , and purple rain (specialty roll with beets) were good. The purple rain was my favorite

My mom and dad shared the tataki ramen, and islander roll, both of which they liked. They weren't fans of the the chicken karaage which was a little soggy and had too much batter or the ahi tuna nigiri

Shizen is my favorite place for vegetarian sushi, but Tataki is a good place to go if you have a group that also wants meat options

* The complimentary tea was good :)
* 5 stars for the atmosphere
* Tidy one person (gender neutral) bathrooms, always a plus :)
author: Sarah N.

description: Love the spicy miso ramen and Tataki ramen. Great quality fish that you can feel good about eating.
author: Sam B.

description: This place is really consistent and has a nice menu. Also ever since they expanded it has become a much nicer place to sit and eat in, rather than just ordering takeout which is what we usually do. Their calamari is surprisingly good and they have very creative sushi rolls. Also they have yummy dipping sauces and great salads.
author: JT B.

description: Very good sushi. Liked it even more knowing I was eating at a sustainable restaurant. Will definitely go back there again.
author: Josh C.

description: Got the Extinguisher and Kingfisher and found the flavor bland. The salmon sashimi was ok, but for the price point I have to admit this was not worth the value. I don't know if they were having an "off" day but it's been a while since I've been this disappointed in SF.
author: David F.

description:
A very enjoyable experience. The wait staff were super friendly and attentive and kept our water full and approached at the right intervals. The restaurant was pretty popular but they don't take reservations but we got a great corner table at 7:30 on a tuesday.

The spicy edamame were the tastiest I've ever had. We ordered a variety of dishes including the golden gate, the extinguisher and others and all were tasty and fresh. Will return. Recommended. $125 for 3 people including drinks.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Long overdue review! This is my favorite sushi spot in SF! I love all of the rolls here. BUT If you go with a few people - make sure to order the RUSSIAN ROULETTE. It's like a sushi game. One of the pieces has spicy jalapeño sauce  and whoever gets the spices one drinks the shot of sake from the center of the plate. 

Also.... Cute decor and not the typical dark cramped hole in the wall sushi. Chill music. Good vibes and good food! Legit 5 star review!
author: Natasha G.

description:
Stopped in for quick drink and a light app. Pretty solid. Drinks are creative, bar stools are funky and our bartender was a cool guy. 

no complaints. Seemed to be a lot of regulars around too.
author: Alison H.

description:
The best part about this place is that they serve ramen and sushi, and they're both good. I notice Japanese restaurants around the city only serve one or the other. If they do serve both, one is lacking or both aren't anything memorable. 

Servers are pretty on top of things. However, a couple times I've been here, service was a bit delayed to start off. Maybe I've just come to expect this, whether or not it is an actual industry standard, but I think the server should come over to a new table a few minutes at most after being seated, say hello, and serve glasses of water. Even acknowledgement to say they'll be right over is reasonable. 

To the food, Arctic char roll and the spicy miso ramen are delicious. It's a bit pricey, but what place isn't in SF and in this neighborhood. I think the price matches the quality though. It's not the best ramen I've ever tasted, but it's decent. Sushi tastes fresh and that's always a mega plus. The ambiance is also posh and refined, yet still casual.
author: Stacey L.

description: Probably my favorite sushi spot in SF. Happy Hour deals are legit and the sashimi is ridiculously fresh and delicious.
author: Mike J.

description: I've walked pass this place a million times and never ever ate here and I kinda regret never stopping in. I was meeting a friend and she said she was going to be near pac heights so I needed to find a restaurant. I wasn't feeling anything too heavy so no American. I yelped a place and tataki came up. Went inside and it was a very cute and intimate spot. Servers sat me right away even before my friend showed up. I ordered the Ramen and a shitake roll. Ramen was tasty with a nice hearty broth. The shitake roll - while not difficulty to make tasted better than lots of places. First, not a lot of people make shitake rolls and second when they do its a mess or they're falling apart. So A+ on keeping it together.
author: Yvonne L.

description: This is one of the best sushi places I've been to in the city! The fish tastes so fresh and flavorful. Every bite was so delicious. Also, I went with 3 other people so it was nice to try how different everyone's order was!
author: Dana S.

description:
Gosh darn, why oh why must I have such a strong reaction to MSG! I am surprised because this place is sustainable and all that good stuff. 

The food was exquisite and delicious. We came right before the end of happy hour so we ordered 2 beers that were $5 each and $5 calamari. H

The beers were surprisingly large! It got us buzzed quick. The calamari was superb. It went really well together. The spicy sauce that came with it was also good. 

Although this place is small, there is only one waitress and one waiter. It was a full house and they were all over the place. Getting beers, swiping cards. But most of the time I saw the food waiting at the pass. 

I ordered uni for the first time and it wasn't what I expected. Yes it was fresh but too creamy for me. 

I also ordered the crunchy spider roll? It was very good. Crunchy and I loved the sauce. 

My bf ordered the zesty scallop roll? I didn't like the zest much an I also didn't like that it was "seared."  There wasn't any color of the sear. Halfway through it, I started to feel the effects of the MSG.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Parking:1/5
Attentiveness: 5/5
Taste: 4/5
 -Presentation: 5/5

As for the service, our group was immediately greeted by our server JD. He was attentive, delightful and was very knowledgeable of the menu. 

Moving on to the food, I recommend their Chefs choice sashimi platter and the Nigiri enthusiast. They were both delicious and most definitely fresh. The presentation of the "extinguisher" was interesting but the taste was only mediocre. We also ordered the tonkatsu ramen which was below expectation. The broth was bland for a rich and creamy soup based. 

All in all, i would come back for their sushi rolls and sashimi but not the ramen.
author: Janny W.

description: This place is a diamond in the rough. I found this place on yelp when I was spending a few days in the city. Their food is amazing and their customer service is better then most.
author: Sam L.

description: The is place makes my mouth happy and my heart light knowing that all the fish are sustainably sources. The food is delicious! Highly recommended!
author: Ashley B.

description:
I went there with couple of my friends on Thursday night and we love it! Tataki has quick service, delicious sushi, and good prices. It's a comfortable environment and they normally have availability. Make sure to get the spicy edamame as an appetizer. They also have a lot of good vegetarian/vegan sushi options and ramen.

They have a great Happy Hour. Normally, I get Tataki as take-out because I live close by, and I have never been disappointed. 

Standout rolls are: golden state, double double, extinguisher, and tataki.
author: Robert s.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday on Saturday. We arrived at 5:30pm because we thought they had happy hour...but they don't have HH on Fridays and Saturdays.

They sat us at one of the high tables which was really small for our party of 6 but we made it work. There are no hooks under the table and the stools have low backs so there isn't really anywhere for you to put your purse or coat.

Anyways, let's talk about the food. I love that Tataki emphasizes sustainability and only serves sustainable fish. All of the fish tasted really fresh and it's nice to try different kinds of fish.

We ordered many dishes to share. We ordered the Tataki roll, Green Flash roll, Sea Dragon roll, garlic edamame, chicken karaage, Tebasaki (chicken wings), kampachi (amberjack) tataki, arctic char with avocado roll, Iwana (arctic char) sashimi and lots of Orion beer and hot sake (this is only on their HH menu not the regular menu so you have to ask for it). My favorites were the Iwana sashimi and kampachi tataki. The Iwana sashimi melted in my mouth. No fishy taste whatsoever. The kampachi tataki was light yet flavorful. All of the rolls were actually really good too. Perfect fish to rice ratio and expertly rolled.

There are many choices for sushi in SF but I'm glad we gave Tataki a chance. The food turned out to be really good. I would recommend this restaurant if you want to be more adventurous and only dine on sustainable fish.
author: Patricia L.

description: Light flavorful miso soup and absolutely delicious sashimi.  Comfy chairs and an intimate setting. Tasteful music selection.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Tataki is a pretty tiny sushi joint in a nice neighborhood that serves fresh fish and sushi rolls at a fairly decent price (for San Francisco, at least). Also, everyone keeps mentioning this because I guess it's a fairly big deal: all the fish is caught sustainably. This means that they can proudly display a "Seafood Watch" sticker on their windows,  letting us all know that all seafood options at Tataki are "well managed and caught or farmed in ways that cause little harm to habitats or other wildlife" (from the Monterey Bay Seafood Watch site). Makes you feel pretty good about yourself!

If you (like me), enjoy rolls that feature a lot of different types of fish, go for the Tataki Roll or the Rainbow Roll, which are served with five different types of fish. The Sashimi and Nigiri platters are also very good, featuring really fresh and delicious fish. There's also a roll called the Extinguisher that is served on fire!

Service is pretty good, but note that you'll have to ask for water and tea refills. Try to avoid coming with a big group because the place is pretty tiny, and they don't take reservations (boo). Next time I'd like to come for happy hour (before 7pm on weeknights) because the prices are so much cheaper!
author: Brittany C.

description:
Came back today with a group of friends and ordered the miso ramen again. It was just as good as I remembered. Others got the tataki and tonkatsu ramen, which were also pretty good. Everyone agreed this was the best ramen they've had so far in SF. 5/5 here. :) 

Sushi unfortunately, was not that great. We shared a tataki roll, which was decent but pretty small. The biggest letdown was actually the toro nigiri that we also ordered. It was $13 for two pieces and the fish was super mediocre. Quality was seriously lacking compared to other sushi restaurants I've had in the same price line. 

Service today was also worse. Our waitress was pretty inattentive and our water glasses were often empty. 

Tldr: Come here for ramen and skip the sushi.
author: Sophia H.

description: Came here on a Sunday night and got seated right away at the bar. They have happy hour everyday from 5-7pm so it's worth ordering from their happy hour menu if you come in during this time! I ordered their agedashi tofu, albacore and tuna nigiri, and a spicy tuna handroll ($5 each for everything)! My favorites were the albacore nigiri and handroll. All of this was enough to fill me up! Would like to come back and try their other menu items!
author: Joyce L.

description: For me, this is a good place to order rolls. The sashimi we ordered was not the tastiest nor the freshest. The Tataki roll was good, as was the Uni nigiri.
author: Laura D.

description: Best sushi I have ever had. Go between 5-7pm for happy hour. Our party ate about 20 pieces each. Salmon avocado roll tastes like buttery heaven in your mouth. Very good prices for the quality.
author: Ramez M.

description:
My girlfriend and I wanted to try something different and as sushi fans, we'd figured to try a "sustainable" spot.  Unfortunately, there were no big takeaways from our visit.

We both ordered the Nigiri enthusiast meal (9 pieces of the chef's choice).  Overall the fish quality was great and helps this review go from 2 to 3 stars, but the rice was very warm (not sure if too much handling or room temperature).  We got an overview of the fish from our server but could barely here him (more on this later).  We asked again for a brief refresher on what fish we had but no real answer.  Long story short, the white fishes tasted the best as the orange/pink fish were meh.  I enjoyed the red snapper while my girl liked the mackerel best.

The overall feel of this place was way too modern for our tastes.  It was very dark, music was too loud and the layout was weird (very small sushi bar area).  The sushi chefs were not personable at all and we enjoy going to sushi places where you can have a nice conversation with the chefs.  Luckily my girl was there to talk about the experience, which unfortunately was average at best.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Great neighborhood spot with inventive, tasty, and sustainably sourced sushi. Lots of vegetarian and vegan friendly options that don't make any sacrifices on flavor or presentation. Great choice of cocktails, too!
author: Owen P.

description: Specialty rolls were most excellent!  Loved the Golden State, Kraken and Green Flash.  Really liked the Extinguisher.
author: Dale S.

description:
They have Orion. It's the beer of Okinawa and it is fantastic. I haven't been able to locate it since I left Japan. Add to that quality fish (sure, not your standard fish offerings from most sushi places), and an amazingly helpful wait staff and you have the perfect combination of elements for a great dining experience. 

Also, go with the chef recommendation - any place worth anything will have a chef aimed at showing you a selection of great fish. Tataki does not disappoint.
author: Shaun P.

description: WOW WOW. I am still dreaming about the extinguisher roll.  I went there with a friend of mine, and we chose Tataki because she is vegan and heard that there were excellent vegetarian options.  The happy hour prices are great, we got edamame, veggie tofu potstickers, and then got rolls - the sweet potato tempura, one of the vegetarian speciality rolls, a crunchy spicy tuna, and the extinguisher.  Would definitely recommend and cannot wait to go back.
author: Maggie A.

description:
I like the ambiance of the one in Glen Park better, but once again....sustainable sushi. Can't beat that.

Rolls:

Arctic Char and Avocado - Nothing special, I wouldn't get it again. There are other amazing rolls here.

Spicy Tempura - As soon as we had a bite of this we ordered another. Delicious. I hadn't eaten shrimp in four years - it is one of the worst things you can eat in terms of bycatch or destroying mangroves - Tataki is the only place I would feel comfortable ordering it.

Double Double - This had me doing the happy yummy food dance. Delicious. It comes out warm. This was our favorite roll.

Russian Roulette - The scallops were really good, but the rest was meh. I had one bite and wasn't going to eat any more. It's a fun idea for a roll (the person who gets the chili sauce gets the sake), but I was not a fan. To be fair I don't really like asparagus though.

Extinguisher - There is some heat here, we didn't even use the sauce on the side. It was solid, kind of outshined by the double double and spicy tempura, but it is worth ordering as well.
author: Kari E.

description:
Really nice sushi bar. They had a lot of options for vegetarian/vegan/gluten free folks. Zack at the bar for what i can describe as "comfortable" service.  
Nice enjoyable happy hour. Glad that they expanded this place from the little tiny shop they had before.
author: Christian H.

description: Great service, great sashimi, clean, fresh.  Everything you'd want in a favorite sushi bar!
author: Brad B.

description:
Customer Service 5/5
Taste 4/5
Distinctness 4/5

The customer service was superb. Despite being packed, our server was always aware of my tables needs. I didn't have to do anything more than simply make eye contact for him to know I needed something.

The taste was pretty good as well. I recommend the calimari. Aesthetically it looks rather dull, but don't be deceived! It falls apart in your mouth and has a good combination of spices. The spicy california roll on the other hand looked beautiful, but the flavor was slightly strong.

As for distinctness, I give it a 4/5. The flavors are not very distinct, however the overall atmosphere and manner of operation are exceptional. They thrive for sustainability and use fish caught using safe practices that don't leave externalities.

I recommend this place if you're around the area
author: David N.

description:
Rolls were good, but the appetizers were disappointing.

The Fried Calamari tasted stale. The Gyoza had a "fresh out of the microwave" texture. The Crab Croquettes were a bit dry.

Rolls fared a lot better in our book. We all enjoyed the seared filet mignon on the Early Bird and the spicy kick the Extinguisher packed. I love cream cheese so I tried their Philadelphia Roll, which deviates a bit from the standard formula and adds avocado. I'm a fan of this modification! The Golden State was an all-around enjoyable roll.
author: Mark C.

description:
My favorite to go item to get here is the nigiri enthusiast. I also love their albacore nigiri and just all of their nigiris in general, BUT especially the albacore one because they top it with some daikon and ponzu sauce. 

Eating sustainable sushi, that makes you feel a little less guilty right?
author: Joanna S.

description: Amazing super fresh sustainable fish. Great service. Awesome green tea. Definitely coming back.
author: Harlow H.

description: Excellent service, food, and atmosphere. Our bartender/server provided exceptional care and attention to our experience. Highly recommend the Sea Dragon roll!
author: Emma K.

description: Service is friendly and attentive. Ambiance is chic and Hip. We had the spicy tuna which was a pleasant surprise because the tuna is left in tact and spiced without the common horror of mixing it with mayo. The Golden Gate is perfectly paired and melts in the mouth. The star of the night was surprisingly the ratatouille. Veggies never tasted so good! All their seafood is self sustainable. Will come here again.
author: Cass B.

description: Amazing food!! Simply perfect!!!! Good job to the chefs and the waiters who are the best!
author: Eleftheria R.

description: Food was decent. Their ramen broth is flavorful but a bit too heavy. I tried their sashimi as well, but don't think that they are really worth the price. Service was good and the restaurant itself had a good ambiance, but don't think I will be returning again.
author: Bella Z.

description: One of our favorite nearby sushi bars. They have a great happy hour, ample seating and awesome servers. I love the tekka roll with cucumber (adding cucumber is $1 extra tho, cucumber =avocado ??). That's okay, it's all worth it cause it tastes yum :p
author: Brianna N.

description:
What a nice place. I've heard good things about this place, and finally had a chance. Although, I loved sashimi and nigiri, their sushi rolls are nothing special. We had extinguisher roll, and I wasn't impressed at all to the point I won't order it again. However, I really enjoyed Tataki roll - recommend if you love rolls. 
We ordered filtered cold sake and it was delicious. They have good variety. 
The service is great. Very nice staff. 
Definitely coming back and definitely recommend.
author: Jenna F.

description: Great atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. This is one of the better sushi spots we've come across in San Francisco, and the prices aren't nearly as high as some others. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Andrew K.

description:
FOUND A WORM IN THE SASHIMI BASKET. 

Consumers beware. Do not eat here. Stay away. 

We were towards the end of eating our meal and as I was grabbing a salmon sashimi I noticed a green little worm twirling around. I am beyond disgusted an DO NOT recommend this spot to anyone.
author: josh m.

description: Yummy food with an interesting selection, nice ambiance, and great service
author: Vika M.

description: Very good sushi! Good service and atmosphere. Will be back on our next trip to San Francisco for sure.
author: Georgia C.

description: Zack was very nice and upbeat. He gave us great food recommendations, such as spicy garlic miso ramen and the purple rain roll (vegan friendly). He had a great attitude and was very accommodating to my diet. While we were dining, I noticed the consistency in his attitude towards all the guest. He provides great customer service. I would definitely come back. Thank you!
author: Joy A.

description: Portions are a bit small for rolls. Ordered a ramen and it was very flavourful. Too much salt in that, but the pork was nice and smoky. A fusion spot I guess. The food is quite tasty but I found portions to be too small across the board.
author: Chance F.

description: We came on a work night when it was still pretty early (about 5ish I think) so we didn't have too much trouble with the wait night. This place was absolutely delicious and had such great presentation. Unfortunately we had ordered too much different types of dishes so I've completely forgotten what we've gotten... oops. The cocktails there looked pretty yummy though so I definitely plan on going back there again (and this time remembering the name of the dishes).
author: Mandy C.

description: Had the tonkotsu ramen and the 12 piece sashimi. Atmosphere was wonderful, not to active but not too quiet, staff was lovely. Decorations and the layout of the restaurant were tasteful. OH MY GOD THE FOOD WAS UNBELIEVABLE. Best sashimi I've had in America outside of Japan. Light, buttery fish that was extremely fresh and flavorful. Very unique original ramen broth flavor. TRY THIS PLACE YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT
author: Sarah N.

description: Tataki started out as my neighborhood go-to but has become my favorite sushi restaurant in SF. The fish is sustainably sourced so you can't get the variety of more expensive places that fly fish in, but it's great quality and delicious. My husband had the Tataki style ramen which I was skeptical about, but it was actually amazing. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Kristin A.

description:
cute little sushi shop in SF.. who can pass that up?

The place is pretty small with only a couple of tables so it has a nice cozy feel to it. They have happy hour every day till 7pm which is awesome because you can enjoy small plates before your meal :) I came here in a group of 4 around 5:30 pm on Sunday night and it wasn't too packed. It took us awhile to get our menus and it might be because there were only two servers but given the restaurant size.. service should have been better. We decided to get:

Fried Calamari: during happy hour its 5 dollars! and it was worth it because it tasted soooo good! The portion was decent.

Sweet Potato cut roll: One of my favorites! surprisingly sweet potato goes really well with rice (: 

Artic Char cut roll: Delicious, very reminiscent to a salmon.

Spicy Tuna hand roll: LOVED THIS. The tuna tasted fresh and spicy.

Golden State roll: This has to be one of the best tasting rolls ever. The crisp apple combined with the yuzu really produced an interesting and delicious taste. The roll was slightly sweet, citrusy, and savory at the same time. Definitely worth getting.

Extinguisher roll: I thought this roll was okay. It tasted good but it wasn't anything special. I thought the fire would actually cook the roll but it didn't, it was more for display.

Kurodai (tataki): I never had farm sea bream before but it was tasty! I think it would be a shame if you came here without ordering a tataki plate because it was unique and they really presented the fish well plus it was easily my group's favorite dish of the night.

Sangria: very fruity :) I loved how they put a lot of fruits in the drink, and the lychee added a nice touch to the drink.

All the food was great, slightly on the pricier end. I'm used to bigger portions for the same price I guess. The one thing that sort of annoyed me was the slow service. They were great with getting the food out on the table until the last roll. I saw our last roll just sit at the sushi bar for 10 minutes and it turned out that they forgot about it. Other than that, I enjoyed dining here.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Restaurant seats 26.  Happy hour until 7pm.  They only serve sustainable fish.  Expect a wait on weekends.

Fire extinguisher roll (habanero masago, tuna) is cool with the corner of salt and alcohol they light on fire.  The roll itself isn't actually that spicy, unless you douse it in the accompanying Sriracha splotch.  Great for pictures, but otherwise would not get again.

Golden state roll (scallops, avocado, apple, yuzu, tuna) was fantastic.  Fish was fresh and the slight tang from the apple and yuzu was so yum.

Uni was fresh and good.

Happy hour rolls were $4.5 for 5 pieces, and had relatively generous portions of fish.  Beats Zushi Puzzle down in the marina, especially since Tataki has an appropriate rice to fish ratio in their rolls.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
One month later and I'm still talking about this sushi. To be fair, we used Yelp to find this place so we knew it'd be good. It's a small restaurant so there's a bit of a wait but it's definitely manageable (especially with the bench outside). 

As for the food... ridiculously fresh, unique, and well-crafted sushi rolls. I had the Golden Gate, which tasted great. The Fire Extinguisher was equally entertaining to watch and, from what I heard, delicious. 

FYI, my party said that the miso soup was the best they'd had. 

Summary: Eat Here!
author: Keren C.

description:
Came here for dinner and had a great experience! Cut sushi rolls are superb. But you don't have to take my word for it, try it yourself ;)

SETTING
-Small restaurant, tables and chairs very close to each other. Intimate indeed.
-Service was good. We were seated right away, (we got there at about 6pm on a weekday). The waitress brought us lemon water.
-It took awhile for us to get our order, nothing too long but enough for me to notice that our food hadn't arrived yet. Then again, it was happy hour and the restaurant filled up soon after we were seated.

FOOD
-Get the Arctic Char Roll with Avocado!! The fish was so fresh and is similar to salmon in appearance and taste. So good and simple. Comes with 5 pieces.
-We also tried the Extinguisher roll... I wanted to see the fancy flames! It came with tuna, masago, and spicy aioli. (Sriracha sauce dots on the plate as well). 
-I also had an order of their Spicy Tuna Roll. It was your standard spicy tuna roll. 

PROS
-Happy Hour! Until 7pm weekly :) $4 cut rolls and $3 hand rolls from their selection of sushi. (Arctic Char Roll is one of them)
-Fresh fish. You can taste the excellence.
-Sustainable Sushi! Tataki is committed to dishing out the best sushi that is good for us and for the ocean.
author: Grace J.

description:
This is my and my boyfriend's favorite Japanese restaurant in SF. 

The best thing on the menu, hands-down, confirmed by the 9 guests I have to-date taken here, is the Nasu Agebitashi which is eggplant soaked in sweet mirin, shoyu, ginger. The eggplant is cold and cut into nigiri-sized pieces. The first time I ordered it I thought it was fish because of the way it's prepared. The flavor is really special and unique - the combo of mirin, shoyu (like soy sauce) and ginger is slightly sweet and goes with the eggplant sooo well. I took my sister here and she said next time she comes to SF she may get this dish for every meal.
 
Other go-to items:

- Katsuo Tataki: Fresh skipjack tuna with just enough mustard and onion to bring out the flavor of the fish
- Arctic Char and Avocado Roll: simple with really high-quality ingredients
- Spinach Gomae: 4 pieces each served on a soup spoon, each bite is a tiny sesame orgasm in my mouth
- Gindara Misoyaki: Flakey grilled sablefish in a delicious miso sauce 

The one time I tried the sashimi salad, I thought the fish was not up to the standard of the other fish dishes I'd tried. I wrote it off as a one-off as everything else I've tried here, on multiple occasions, is very fresh.

My boyfriend sometimes orders the ramen, which has a really special smokey broth and is a great cheaper option.
author: Camille E.

description:
It was my first time there, food was good, but service not really. First i was sitted by the table with a spil near it and they were cleaning it in front of me. Not nice. The restraunt was almost empty to sit me some other place. Secondly, even i ordered during happy hour, they included full price for my order. 
I ordered fried calamari, they were really fresh and tasty and not overcooked.
Can be more items on happy hour. Both food and drinks.
author: Lizzz K.

description: Tataki is one of our favorites which we visit as often as possible. It's a solid sushi joint that you can dine, guilt free, as it's sustainable! My favorites have to be shiro maguro, iwana (artic char), uni, ikura. Combo this with a agedashi, tempura, or another fav appetizer and you'll be stuffed.
author: Jordan H.

description:
Socal-quality sushi, with SF-quality creativity. 

[BACKGROUND]

Yelp discovered by a friend, who suggested it for a catch-up dinner.  It's a nice place especially for special occasions (including celebrating Fridays).

[NICE AMBIANCE... AND LOTS OF TIME TO ADMIRE IT]

Naturey theme, with very nice wooden tables, a bamboo wall divider, and little pendant lamps.  It's an extremely small restaurant, so on the one hand it's cozy and feels Japanese but on the other hand the wait takes FOREVER.  Even a party of four is considered large because they have so few tables.  They don't take reservations either, so plan your timing very strategically.

The rolls also take quite awhile, and there is a long lag in between each roll.  I'm surprised, because sushi chefs usually whip stuff up pretty quickly.  

[FOOD AND DRANKS]

Everything about the rolls is stellar, except that the portions seem very small in terms of number of pieces and also the size of each piece.  5 rolls for 4 girls and still hungry afterwards.  

(+++) Extinguisher, $13 (albacore tuna, avocado, habanero masago, spicy aioli): Tip: get your camera ready!  You will get trigger-happy because this roll is served with fire on the side.  You'll be wanting to snap multiple photos because you get different flame patterns.  Also, since it's on a long plate, try to get an angle near the end of the plate to include all the sushi pieces.  Oh wait, this is Yelp, not a photo forum--back to food.  It's an interesting mix of rich foods (sashimi, avocado, sauces) and a complex spiciness.  

(+++) Tataki, $13 (5 varieties of seared fish, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, sweet sauce): Probably the most traditional of the specialty rolls because it doesn't have much sauce.  Good for people who enjoy sashimi and don't want it adulterated with gimmicks.

(-) Early Bird, $13 (asparagus, avocado roll topped with seared filet mignon and pineapple): This is quite popular but I personally didn't like it too much.  The sushi rice and filet mignon synergistically devalue each other.  The avocado addition just makes it even more mushy and bland.

(++) Green Dragon, $15 (shrimp tempura roll, faux-nagi, avocado, wasabi tobiko):  I have no idea what faux-nagi is, but it seemed exactly like unagi to me.  This is a tasty roll, especially for anyone afraid to eat raw sashimi.

(+++) Pacific Sunrise, $12 (cucumber wrap with 4 varieties of fish, garlic ponzu sauce, no rice): Perhaps my favorite.  Being riceless with only a thin cucumber wrap, the sushi predominates and goes very well with the lemony ponzu sauce.  The julienne daikon garnish adds a nice crunch.

(+/-) House sangria: very fruity blend of lychee, grapefruit, and berries. This is + or - depending on your preference for fruity vs strong drinks.  I personally prefer the latter kekeke

For 2 drinks per person plus sharing this, it came out to $40 per person.  o.o  I guess this is the standard for classy food in SF, but in the rest of the Bay Area it would be around $20-30 for this level.

Conclusion: Delicious and caters to a wide variety of tastes, but be sure to bring a small appetite, a lot of money, and patience.
author: Edna C.

description:
The best thing this place has going for them, is the bartender.  We ordered spicy tuna hand rolls and we ended up getting a roll filled with mayo and nearly no tuna. 

The waiter was worthless.  We ate whatever food was decent and ran out of there.  We will never return.  


 Try at your own risk!!!
author: David C.

description: Great ambiance! Good ramen! Amazing drinks!! Friendly service. Very hipster trend place. Love.
author: T E.

description:
First time client.
The hostess was very courteous and efficient; she really seemed on top of her game as she helped keeping the tables neat and clean.
The bartender was really helpful, actually happy to be able to explain some of the sake option they have on their list and his recommendation met exactly what wanted.
Our waiter was polite and caring but not super energetic nor knowledgeable however I can sure deal with that.
We only had a few things: what we ordered was a different flavor profile than the norm and that goes in their favor and it was good to try something a bit different however next time I might try to ask to not sear (with the torch?) some of the rolls. I did not enjoy that but that is my personal taste and it was clearly stated on the menu this was the preparation. The colors and the attention to details in presentation was impeccable and original we even saw some other table order a roll that was actually served on fire!! Well done.
author: A. G.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, we were able to find this place when we were craving sushi in San Fran. We came on a Friday evening and had to wait a bit. The restaurant is dimly lit, small, and cozy. We got to sit at the bar so that was nice getting to watch the chefs.

Their miso soup was quite tasty. Their rolls were decent. What I couldn't get enough of was the ebi which had a hint of sweetness to it. Ask for a quail egg on top and you're good to go! The sangria was also delish, though on the lighter side.
author: Wendy H.

description: From my daughter :-) VERY GOOD!! The food tasted fresh and local. I appreciate the sustainable sushi as a business model. I highly recommend Tataki. As a vegan, I am always looking for veggie options and I can say this hit the spot. I will for sure be returning.
author: Peretz S.

description:
If you want to have Ramen don't go to this place.
Can't say anything about sushi, but uni was not fresh.
Service was great and place is pretty.
author: Maria M.

description: One of my favorite sushi places in the city! Not only is the food amazing (the spicy & garlic edamame is a must!), but I love how accommodating they are to my dietary restriction (I can't eat gluten). Their menu clearly shows what is gluten-free and what isn't, and I don't even have to ask for gf soy sauce! All the soy sauce on their tables is already gluten free. A go-to place for dinner with my friends.
author: Liza P.

description: This is a cute little sushi spot. Came here on a Friday night right when the doors opened. The restaurant filled up quickly. We ordered the tataki roll and a rainbow roll and a couple nigiri. The rolls were tasty and fresh and elegantly displayed. I wanted to try the extinguisher roll but got scared off by the spicy looks of it. I would come here if I were in the area again.
author: Christina G.

description:
Small cozy spot. Most likely wait 30mins. On point with the food. Have the EXTIGUISHER ROLL, crab croquettes and poke tuna app. 

#wewillbebackagain
author: Leiani P.

description: This place was great! High quality sushi and great service. I waters and drinks were never even close to empty and all the food came out so fast! I loved the extinguisher roll and the kraken roll but everything we had was really good. We will definitely be back
author: Samantha J.

description: A really fun, trendy spot for sushi in SF. The overall decor was very cute and set the mood for a night of dinner and drinks! After a few drinks in, we ordered the fire extinguisher and to our surprise it was presented with fire on the side of the plate. That presentation alone made me love this place it was a lot of fun. I would highly suggest this spot for anyone looking for some good sake and sushi!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
My wife is constantly on the lookout for good sushi spots, so we decided to stop in based on the Yelp reviews on a Tuesday night.  It's a pretty small place inside but thankfully we were able to be seated without having to wait too long!  One thing that is nice is their happy hour menu that goes until 7pm.  We got the spicy tuna roll and arctic char & avocado roll ($4.50 each for a 5 piece roll) and the $5 fried calamari.  Both rolls were pretty good and we enjoyed our calamari as well.  I found it interesting that they try to use sustainable fish, so this might be a good place if you're into that kind of thing.  The arctic char is similar to salmon and is more sustainable fishing, that's why they use it.

We also got a rainbow roll ($13), which is a standard of sorts that I use to judge sushi spots, and the tataki roll (same price), which has seared fish on top of a cucumber/avocado roll.  We enjoyed both of our rolls.  The rainbow roll had pretty decent sized slices of fish on the top which were fresh, and the CA roll filling was very tasty as well.  The tataki roll was tasty also and looked really nice with the different color tobiko they used to top it!  

The only real complaint I had about the food was the water we were served.  Each glass had a slice of cucumber in it- kind of like "spa water" but the taste was a little funky for me so my wife and I didn't take more than a couple sips.  We also heard the lady at the next table comment about it as well and the waitress just shrugged it off.  Perhaps this is their ploy to get you to buy the happy hour beer!
author: Jeff C.

description: We just came here for my girlfriends birthday and they completely took our night from good to great! Most amazing service, best cocktails, best food! Ansley and Zach were the two that really made this place epic! Thanks for the awesome night we will be back for sure!!!!
author: Chad D.

description: The rice is too dry and hard to swallow. Sashimi is so so. The service is ok. If fact, there are many choices in this area. You can come a try if you are in hurry and it is difficult to find other place.
author: Siyat U.

description: I love Tataki. I've had several good meals at this restaurant conveniently located in my neighborhood. It's fairly priced and always tasting fresh. I'm giving one star for now until my faith is restored. Tonight we had a terrible experience. There were four people at my table. We all ordered a couple of things. My mom received both dishes. I received both. My boyfriend received one. My sister nothing. After that food was delivered THEN the waitress practically threw his hot tea on the table in front of him and ran away. I couldn't believe it didn't burn my mom or boyfriend. Eventually my sister finally received her dish. I saw the bartender whisper something to the waitress when she had a horrified expression on her face. We had just finished our entire meal and my boyfriend STILL hadn't received his ramen. She came over to explain we were out. How are you out of ramen on a Saturday at 7. And how did we not know about it until the end of our meal. We left her a little tip but jeez- if I return any time soon I had better be wowed. I'm so disappointed. I've never gone to dinner and returned with the entire family making grilled cheese after buying sushi. I might give you your stars back if I get an apology. This waitress just LET all this happen. Barely an "I'm sorry". Ridiculous
author: Kayleigh L.

description: Great fresh sustainable sushi friendly service nice happy hour prices  expanded space due to popularity good ramen too
author: Cynthia Y.

description: Delicious. Tasty Sushi and sashimi presentations and selections. The Raman dishes were enjoyed by our nephews. Vegetarian dishes were artfully presented and delicious.
author: Alli N.

description: My friends and I came here in early September, but I forgot to write a review, so this might not be the most up-to-date/accurate review ever. Anyways, we came during happy hour and we left very satisfied! We ordered some sashimi, simple rolls, and calamari to start and they were all delicious. the sashimi was actually super fresh! Highly recommend. The most memorable specialty roll was the Extinguisher (they light a pile of salt(?) on fire!), but the spicy albacore and Pacific sunrise were excellent as well. Definitely a great place to go to during happy hour - it won't break your wallet! It is a small restaurant though, so I wouldn't recommend going here if you have a large group.
author: Trisha V.

description: I was in the  area on business and was looking for a good Japanese restaurant near my Hotel. I was recommended to the Tataki Restaurant just down the street from where I was staying. I ordered the Tataki Special Ramen and an order of Philadelphia rolls and was not disappointed. It comes topped with pork belly, a soft boiled egg, seaweed, and bamboo. With its smoky flavor the Tataki Special Ramen was packed with savory goodness in each bite and the noodles complimented the broth nicely as they tasted very fresh. The Philadelphia roll is one of my favorites and I order it every where I go  , I enjoyed the tuna and cream cheese flavors and the presentation offered by Tataki. Overall a great experience, very nice atmosphere and wonderful staff. Will be returning next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Elliott A.

description:
I'm a server and am really picky about servers. That being said- JD IS AMAZING. He is seriously the best server I've ever had. My boyfriend left him at 20% tip and then I gave him my last cash just because I wanted him to have more. 

The food is good too. Like really good. JD made great recommendations. 

I wonder if JD is reading this. If you are, Hi! We will be back. And thank you for the pastry rec too! -Lauren & Thomas
author: Lauren C.

description:
3.5 stars. 

Come for happy hour! The happy hour roll (crunchy spicy tuna) was really good and worth the price. So was the draft Asahi. I also ordered the Kaisen salad and liked that they gave me a lot.

The nigiri was fresh but the portions were smaller than I am used to. The "plates" they have also were a little lacking in size. I felt that the Tako was too salty for my own taste buds, but presentation was pretty. 

Service was efficient and friendly. Ambience was clean, modern, and simple- I like!
author: Kate L.

description:
I'm so sad I actually want to cry. The beloved Tataki, my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco is gone...expanded into a cold, clean, modernly upgraded, alternative electronic music playing, high bar stool sitting, marconi filament lighted, just like every other sushi restaurant now...complete with luminous neon signs out front. 

I took everyone that is special to me to Tataki because it was so small & warm & sweet & crowded & lively &....& just... lovely. 

Oh...& they took my favorite rolls off the menu. 

I die now. The world is over.
author: Marisa P.

description: We came for dinner after reading the splendid reviews on Yelp. The service was OK and the food was average. We were expecting more given the reviews in here. We ordered the Sashimi Deluxe, the Tataki Roll and Uni Nigiri. The sachimi could have been fresher. The Tataki roll was pretty good -- definitely the best we had during our dinner. The uni nigiri was also delicious. I'll definitely give it a second chance next time I am in the neighborhood.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Really great spot with a nice selection of Japanese beers (we shared a Koshihikari Echigo rice lager and an Orion beer). We ordered mostly nigiri-the King Salmon, Shiro Maguro, and Katsuo were all outstanding, as was the Double Double roll.

I'm so happy to have a great sushi restaurant within walking distance from my house!
author: Rachel C.

description:
I discovered Tataki Sushi Bar two years ago when I first moved into Pacific Heights. I heard that it was a great spot for delicious fresh sushi that was farmed with sustainable farming practices. It sounded like a dream come true. The only problem is if you arrive past 7pm or so to the 15-20 seat restaurant expect to wait! The restaurant is quite small, part of the charm so plan ahead and go early, or grab a drink next door at Wild Hare while you're waiting. Another option is to call ahead and carry out.  This is what I do most of the time and I love it. You'll see below my experiences dining in and carryout out Tataki! Check it out I,  promise you'll enjoy it!! 2815 California St. San Francisco, CA. 415-931-1182.

P.S. A tip I'm going to share with you is that Tataki Sushi Bar has a fabulous happy hour menu served until 7pm (note it's dine in ONLY). Menu includes the below.

Happy Hour Roll Menu $3.00 - $4.50: Crunchy California Roll, Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll, Arctic Char/Avocado Roll, Sweet Potato Tempura Roll & Mixed Vegetable Roll . Happy Hour Drinks Menu $2.50 - $5.00: Select Beers & Sangria

Thanks for checking out my post I hope you enjoy dining with The JetSetting Fashionista. Emily
author: JetSettingFashionista J.

description: Sashimi platter are fresh and some of them we don't see in other restaurants. The extinguisher roll is very unique! You don't see fire just on any dishes.
author: M W.

description: The Fire Extinguisher is phenomenal if you like spicy and flare. Excellent ramen and saki list.
author: Megha V.

description:
Very good food but the service was ok. 
My friend ordered a miso soup at the very beginning, it was cold. We asked to the server and requested to change another one or at least heat it up. 10 mins later, he brought back the cold one again! 
It's a tiny restaurant with only two servers that night. The female server was great and very helpful and seemed like she has to cover the male server( the one who served us). Also, they charge you for your drink refills and we were not told about this!

We order some sashimi and the extinguisher roll are excellent! No doubt on their food!!
author: LuLu S.

description: The chirashi was a solid pick. The quality of the fish was evident and the waiting staff was great.
author: Rodrigo C.

description:
The ramen was great, very surprisingly good!

The agedashi tofu, not so much.

I do like that they have a different selection of fish than the usual places. (This is because they only use sustainably caught fish.)
author: Andrea F.

description:
Came here twice on our three day trip to San Fransisco. The staff is great and the sushi is as fresh as it can be. Our waiter suggested some great appetizers and some even better rolls.

Happy hour from 5-6:30 includes food and drinks
author: Joshua K.

description: I first started eating sushi in Tokyo, where the average dive is better than anything you'll find in Berkeley. Then I discovered Sugar Fish in LA, which is mighty excellent. This is just our second sushi adventure since returning to SF, but we've found our home. This is melt-in-your-mouth sushi. So, so good.
author: Adriel H.

description: Tataki has some really great food - the fish is great; the Tataki plates really stood out. We had the octopus and the amberjack plates and the amberjack was phenomenal. The sake flights were really nice too, we tried the mid- and high-tier two, which were perfect to split. The best part was the service though, we had two servers who were insightful with the menu and made us feel like proper guests. Planning on returning soon.
author: Tyler M.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. I came here about 3 times for dinner and today (9/16/14) for lunch. 

I've had a pretty good experience here for dinners. Pretty good dinner sashimi but I think their rolls are really delicious and that's what their regulars must love. 

I had sushi combo here for lunch and I wasn't too impressed with the fish (freshness, taste and even visually it wasn't pleasing). It was A-OK as yelp puts it. 

I recommend dinners here and definitely rolls!
author: Sarah K.

description:
I feel like the times I happen to go to Tataki, it wasn't too packed. I didn't wait too long to get seated. I feel like lunch time would be less pack than dinner as well.

I don't necessarily recall my rolls I ordered during dinner time that one time, but I will comment about my lunch meal! 

I ordered a lunch special and a mixed vegetable udon soup. I ordered the udon soup because the couple next to us was eating it, and it looked so delicious!

So for the sushi combo lunch, we ordered 1 roll and it came with 4 pieces of chef's choice nigiri. We ordered the arctic char/avocado roll, which was very good! Overall, the fish was delicious and fresh! I like the sashimi at this restaurant. This also came with either a mixed salad or miso soup. We got the salad. The vegetables were crispy and I like the sesame dressing on top. The salad was amazing.

I think the udon soup was a little bland but I like the texture of the noodles, and all the vegetables in it. We asked for red pepper and they gave it to us, which made it taste a lot better.

The waitress was very nice and was able to split the lunch special between us since we were sharing everything. The waitress was a little out of it though, I felt like she didn't pay a lot of attention to the customers. She was nice, and responded if you needed anything, but she didn't really follow up on us. 

Notes:
You can pay with card here but remember $15 minimum.
It's a very small location. So plan ahead or order to-go ahead of time. 
On the menu, it says they charge 25 cents for each to-go container.
author: Margaret L.

description: This place was delicious! Great atmosphere, delicious food, affordable prices, and a really tasty beer selection. I would highly recommend! I had a great time here.
author: Sabra M.

description:
For the price, I can definitely go to other Japanese restaurants and be full.

The place is trendy and the food seems quite inventive but it's lacking on flavor. Not that it taste bad. It's just eh...

The desserts are such disappointments. I have sweet tooth and I almost always enjoy anything sugary but the green tea and chocolate mousse? It's worse than a disappointment. Bf concurred although he likes something on the milder side. Something is missing. The green tea mousse was too bland. The chocolate on the other hand was too rich. Other than the original flavor of chocolate and green tea, something is missing and lacking. I need more complexity.

For the food, we got extinguisher, the pork belly appetizer and artic char roll.

The portions were so tiny, I almost cried. This coming from someone who doesn't eat that much. And funny thing, bf who generally eats less than me, agreed that the portions are too small and hence, ordering 2 desserts instead of sharing as usual.

Extinguisher is cool. They lit the salt on the plate. I'm guessing you dipped the extinguisher on this? Tried it and think it's better without. The sauce is nice if you like the typical Americanized/fusion sushi. But I still think something is missing.

Arctic char is also a decent roll. Again, very tiny portion.

Pork belly can use more bold flavors and not too chewy. It's okay. But I ate better pork bellies in the past month so this is pale in comparison to other Japanese restaurants that I tried. The bun was too sweet and too thick, overpowering the pork belly.

As said, the place is kinda hip (but what's with the lights that seem flickering when I first went in) and if you like to drink and socialize, this is probably fun. Sustainable fish... For you hipsters out there ;) cool menu design for the graphic designers... A deep pocket for you trust fund babies... Or if your companies want to pay for your business lunch/dinner. I'll skip next time.

Ps: b patisserie is just next door
author: Cliff T.

description:
We stopped in here because it was open later and I looked them up on Yelp and saw so many good reviews and pictures. We got there around 8:50 pm.

I loved this little hole in the wall - felt very authentic! There isn't a lot of tables but if you go at the right time I guess when it's not too busy you will get seated fairly quickly. 

This is what we ordered:

1. The Extinguisher - very tasty! and so cool that it's served with a live flame!!

2. Baked Mussels - well done, simple but a nice little starter

3. Mix It Up - spicy tuna with some sweet sides

4. Double Double - another tuna roll but tempura'd

5. Tuna Tataki Salad - very fresh and good portion of meat 

6. Calamari - small serving for the price but not bad 

7. Chicken/Pork Gyozas - I think these were on special the day that we were here, i loved these so much I ordered a serving to go

I also had the Kin Sangria - a little light on the liquor but that's ok it was still yummy!

It was such a great meal we even ordered some to go!! brought it back to the hotel in case we got hungry around midnight.

Compared to Sushi in Vancouver the prices were a little higher but honestly for the quality and taste it was SO worth it.
author: Hannah H.

description: Creative, tasty, juicy rolls with very fresh fish. A rare place that can do new delightful things with sushi while keeping it true to what it should be.
author: Lekan W.

description:
This may be the best sushi I've ever had. High praise for sure.

What makes their offerings extra special is that they serve sustainable fish. Like others mentioned, this is not a place to come with a big group. it is a tiny place. I came with three friends that's probably the max you should take to try this place.

Must have's: 

Kin-san-gria
(fresh fruit, sake& riesling) easy drinking even if you are not a sake fan (I'm not) the fruit was lychee, strawberries, raspberries and blueberries.

We also got the special of pork and chicken dumplings- must order.

On a sushi front I recommend all we tried including:

extinguisher
spicy albacore, avocado, habanero masago, spicy aioli

mix it up
spicy albacore, cucumber, topped with mix crab, avocado citrus

green dragon
shrimp tempura roll topped with faux-nagi (seared sablefish, sesame seeds, kabayaki sauce), avocado, wasabi tobiko

pacific sunrise
four varieties of fish, garlic ponzu, cucumber wrap ( no rice)

Very accommodating for vegetarians and those with allergies as well. Our wait was only about 30 minutes on a recent weeknight.
author: Elisabeth B.

description: Great place for a special twist on Sushi.  They have some very creative dishes.  "The extinguisher"  it's a great spicy tuna roll.  "Russian roulette roll" is a fun roll for groups.  Watch out only one piece has spicy habanero sauce on it.  It comes with one shot of sake for the lucky person who gets the spicy one.  You can tell the owner/chef takes pride in not only taste but the presentation as well.  I will be back again for sure!
author: Donald L.

description:
I've been going to Tataki for years, and I'm still a big fan.  Ever since their expansion into the new venue a few doors down from the old hole in the wall I've been pretty impressed with them.  They have a great sake selection and good quality fish.  

I don't usually get anything but their signature rolls, of which I almost always get the Golden State and Tataki rolls.  The spiced apple in the Golden State adds a great refreshing taste.  

For appetizers I find the garlic edamame is to die for if you're a big garlic fan.  It comes piled with chipped garlic and some sort of soy glaze which compliment the dish perfectly.  

San Francisco is a city that offers endless sushi options, but if you're in the area Tataki is worth checking out.
author: Bobby L.

description: Love this place, they use sustainably caught fish and have a great selection of more traditional sushi/sashimi as well as some fun original rolls. Love the extinguisher roll. I've dined in and ordered takeout and both were awesome quality. There are lots of small plates if you aren't feeling the sushi. Tastes super fresh. Really want to go back and try the ramen!
author: Amber R.

description:
This place was awesome! Shared the Tataki ramen which is a must if your craving soup. We also got the extinguisher roll and the Spicy tuna roll, both I would recommend. 

They have a ton of experimental sushi for vegetarians, will have to try next time! 

All around, great restaurant and great service with amazing food.
author: Meggan W.

description:
Good setting, great service, amazing sushi rolls and delicious deserts! :-) My favorite was the extinguisher roll and the custard desert.
Staff was really good n let us stay inside even after closing time until our ride arrived.
author: Nachiket B.

description: Loved the Sushi and the ambiance. The extinguisher is a must have if you can handle the HOT!
author: Manisha D.

description:
We live near Tataki and consistently love everything we order. Tonight: futomaki, Gabri Saba roll, Golden State (longtime fav), Green Flash (1st time), and attic char and King Salmon. Everything was superb. 

The only thing that makes me unhappy about Tataki is that they won't make their fabulous ramen to go - why not?!
author: R. P.

description: Sit at the bar (the bar bar, not the sushi bar) and hope that Andrea is your server. She is so sweet and friendly. Also, come on a weeknight to avoid the crowds. They have a great happy hour and sexy vibe. Love this neighborhood joint!
author: Claudia H.

description:
I had yet to find a go-to sushi spot in San Francisco...then I stumbled upon Tataki. And now I do! Holy moly. 

One of the first appealing things to notice about Tataki is their use of sustainable seafood. Yes, there is something to be said about wild, ocean-grown fish. But if it can be sustainable and still taste amazing than why not! I have seen other reviewers mention that the fish is bland and that's why Tataki has sauce (lots of hot sauce) on pretty much every dish, but personally I prefer more sauce and thought that the fish had great flavor. I guess it's just personal preference. 

I came in around 6 on a Saturday night and, as expected, there was already a wait. This place is very small and intimate and there are not many tables/seats. However we only waited about 15-20 minutes before being offered a seat at the counter - a chance to watch the sushi chefs in action! I'll take it. Definitely not a place to bring a large group however. 

We ordered the crab croquettes to start, which were made with sweet potatoes and veggies. They mostly tasted like sweet potatoes to me, not much crab flavor, and had some sort of spicy barbecue sauce drizzled on top. I love sweet potatoes, so they were pretty damn good in my opinion and my sister loved them as well. I almost wish they had another type of sauce on them though, as the barbecue was a bit overpowering. 

We also ordered the early bird roll and the extinguisher roll. This is where it went from good to great. The early bird roll is very different than anything I've seen at a sushi restaurant. Inside the rice is asparagus, avocado, and pineapple and on top is seared filet mignon. The combination of flavors was beyond amazing. You couldn't really taste each individual ingredient, which I thought was actually great because the flavors mixed so well. Very non-tradition sushi (no fish!), but it was definitely my favorite thing that I tried. The extinguisher roll was also excellent. It was made with albacore tuna, avocado, habanero masago, and spicy aioli. It also came with fire on the plate! Literally fire. It was perfectly spicy and again, the combination of flavors was just delicious. A+ on food and presentation. 

The service was quick, helpful, and friendly. One of the benefits to being a restaurants with limited seating. Our water came with cucumber...a great touch and perfect for refreshing your burning mouth after the spicy sushi. They also were very good about keeping our drinks (Chardonnay) refilled at our desire. 

Looking at the menu you can tell that Tataki had limited ingredients..but what they do they do really, really well. All of the menu items here looked amazing and I will be back to try more!
author: Emma B.

description: I had high expectations before heading to the restaurant. I thought the decor was nice, the cocktail I ordered (a soju sangria ) was great. The service we had was also wonderful. The main problem was the food. We first got the salmon special which came out as a mediocre roll instead of the sashimi we were looking for, which was a miscommunication.  The waitress apologized and offered to switch it but we were hungry so just ate it and got the tuna skipjack sashimi instead. It was fishy and awful. We ordered the squid which came out deep fried although the menu description made it sound grilled. The tataki was good , although pretty expensive. The waitress was kind a brought us a dessert since we had so mix ups through out the meal. With so many sushi places in sf , I won't be returning to this one.
author: brittany g.

description:
3 stars for food, + 1 star for conservation.  I really like the idea of Guilt-Free sushi.   Finally, a sushi place that looks towards sustainability.

Pros:   I highly recommend the vegetarian rolls.   We ordered the mixed veggie roll and sweet potato roll.  The sweet potato tempura was wrapped in rice and nori, topped off with a dark sauce.   A rich and warm delight.  

Another plus is  Arctic char and avocado roll.  Arctic char is similar to salmon, without the slum conditions that normal farmed salmon endure.  

Dessert was a highlight.  We ordered the kinako mochi.  Imagine a S'mores, Japanese style.  Doubly yummy.  
 

Cons:  I always try rolls wrapped in cucumber, but I found the Pacific Sunrise lacking in taste and texture.  It's also stuffed with tuna along with other fish.   I'm not a fan of tuna, and I found Albacore less tasty than Bluefin tuna.  The other fish rolls weren't thrilling either.  

Lastly,  I loved the casual, not-snooty environment.  I'd come back for the veggie rolls and to hear Talking Heads humming on the sound system.
author: Emma R.

description:
I came across this place by yelping for sushi. It's located in the heart of glen park. Parking was surprisingly easy. Very pretty ambiance. It's a small cozy place so there was a 20min wait. 
As my best friend and I were seated, we decided to order seaweed salad, rice, 24 pc assorted sashimi and spicy miso ramen. 
All I can say was that every bite I had, was worth the wait and the money.  
The assorted sashimi was very fresh and very nicely put on a decorative plate. The fish was so fresh that it melted right in your mouth. Although we got the biggest plate of sashimi it was so good it left us wanting more. We ordered a side of seaweed salad and you might not want to share that. It came in a very tiny portion just for one person for $5 so make sure to order your own. We also decided to order a side of sushi rice and again very small portion dodo not share it get your own. The rice was very flavorful so Moshe sure to get a taste of it bc you won't regret it.
We usually like to order plain miso soup but this time we decided to try somethings different, we got the spicy miso ramen. It is spicy to its perfection and a lot of flavor it came with pork belly, seaweed, and egg. 
I recommend this place to everyone! All of Te food was cooked to its best! The staff is very friendly but it is an understaffed place so please have patience because I promise the wait will be worth the experience. I will definitely come back and I absolutely found my favorite Japanese restaurant I the city!!! Thank you tataki!
author: Stacy G.

description:
Tiny cute place. Food was wonderful
Fresh fish! Recommend to visit in happy hours $4 L supporo!! I will come back!
author: Fah Z.

description:
Went here a few times and loved it and had great food New Years Eve too. Had a craving for both Sake and Ratatouille Roll. Now, just so you understand, on New Years we ate like 5 Ratatouille Rolls (between 8 of us) with other stuff too. Two of us even ordered one more for dessert, that's how killer this roll was with the crunchy eggplant tempura inside and topped with this orgasmic sauce, and toasted garlic. Holy @hit. So good.   

Ok, now fast forward to tonight. Not sure what happened. Maybe a different sushi chef, but was not up to standard. Inside tempura was soft, not crunchy, the sauce didn't have the pizzaz, and there wasn't enough of it, and the roll itself seemed to be smaller than is was the last few times we were there. We also had the Purple Rain which has killer flavor normally, but seemed to also be lacking the zest and the impactful flavor it had before. Maybe it was missing the dots of sauce on the top??? And, that roll also seemed to be smaller than before. We hope it was just an off night (Sunday), or an off chef. Will update when the craving arrives again!!!!!
author: Jessie S.

description: I saw the reviews and wanted to try it out. The food was okay, nothing special. i sat at the bar. The service was average. I wanted to like it more yet but just wasn't  there.
author: Patrick D.

description: LOVEEEEE Tataki. The fish is so fresh and flavorful! They also only serve sustainable fish which is a plus! The sushi chefs are always so friendly and entertaining. Prices are average for a sushi restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Aspyn L.

description:
Highly recommend the sashimi deluxe. A good variety of fresh fish that is apparently caught sustainably. The plating is artistic but not overwhelming, and the portion is quite big. 

The arctic char roll is also my favorite, especially with a bottle of half priced Sapporo beer during happy hour ;)

No waiting time for both of my visits, no complaints about that :p. Will definitely go again.
author: Rachel Z.

description: I ate here for the first time and I found it an okay meal.  We got there in time for happy hour and ordered the spicy tuna roll and the california roll.  The spicy tuna roll has some peanut flavor in it that I didn't find appealing.  The california roll is a mixture of crab and imitation crab mixed in a mayo sauce. The pork gyoza was pretty good.  Check your bill carefully because they added a glass of wine we never received. When we asked about it, the excess was politely removed. This felt like a neighborhood place, strollers parked at the entrance, got busy at about 7:30 or so.
author: Alexa S.

description:
If I were to rate Tataki solely based on their food, it would be five stars for sure. It's fresh, flavorful and all around delicious!

The service on the other hand would be two stars.

My first time coming here was on their first day at their new location (I didn't know it was their first day at the time). We were seated and ordered right away and anxiously waited for our food to arrive. We waited, and waited and finally after about 30 minutes of sitting there got our server's attention and asked for the status of our food and were told it would be right out. Another 15 minutes later we asked again for anything, even our edamame and were again told it would be out soon. Finally after an hour of sitting there our rolls arrived, and 15 minutes after that we were finally presented with our edamame (were they hand picking it out back? What took so long?!).

Because the food was THAT GOOD, I decided to get take out a few weeks later. I went in to place and was told it would be 1.5 hours before my food would be ready, so I left empty handed.

Today I decided to give them one final try. We sat, ordered and everything seemed promising as people around us were getting their food. We got our edamame right away (yay!) but about 35 minutes in our server came and asked is to "remind him of what our order was." I figured he must have messed something up and didn't put the order in, but about 10 minutes later all of our food except our gyoza appetizer came out. We asked for the gyoza as two additional times and finally got them well after we were done with our rolls.

Tataki, I really wanted to like you because I like your food, but after 3 strikes I am out for good!
author: Staci L.

description: Their namesake, the tataki, was average at best, their sushi relies on gimmicks and weird names and "fire" which is all fine. It's been around and will probably continue to be patronized for those just looking for "sushi," any sushi. It was fine. Don't expect anything other than to fill yourself, with what happens to be sushi.
author: Victoria C.

description: Solid sushi.  The fish was fresh and sustainable.  Great ambiance and service.  Would definitely go back.
author: Paul W.

description:
Good...but not great sushi....but not worth more than a 15 minute wait.  Easier for smaller parties.  I went with a friend and we were seated within 10 min at the sushi bar.  Ordered 80 dollars worth of food.....left feeling hungry.  

Good choice when you're nearby and having a sushi craving.
author: Justin P.

description: Most delicious sushi and Zach the bartender was the best. He's the reason we came back again
author: Chloe L.

description: Hit and miss.  Not comparable to real Japanese sushi.  The only good thing was salmon sashimi special.  They don't even have real tuna - albacore on everything.
author: Ruslan K.

description: My husband and I went as soon as they opened. There was us and only one other couple in the whole restaurant. We opted to sit next to each other on one side of the table, something we do often. We ordered our drinks and then we were told that we are not allowed to sit next to each other.
